explanation: OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET - macro definition is required to verify how the argument '*token' is used/evaluated (e.g. whether the macro performs assignments or multiple evaluations of the expression) and to ensure it does not modify the token parameter. OS_impl_task_table - the table symbol/definition can show whether the table access macro writes into the passed index or expects an lvalue, which could imply modification of the passed token expression. OS_impl_task_internal_record_t - the record type is needed to confirm the result of OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET is a pointer to a structure (and to understand any side effects of accessing impl->id), ensuring no hidden modifications to the token occur. OS_object_token_t - the token type definition is needed to determine whether '*token' is an lvalue, what its const qualification means in context, and whether any callee/macro expects to modify that object. OS_ObjectIdFromToken - the prototype/implementation is required to check whether this function takes a const pointer or a non-const pointer (i.e. whether calling it could modify the object referred to by token). OS_ObjectIdToInteger - its prototype/behavior is needed to confirm it takes a value (not a pointer) and does not modify token. OS_DEBUG - macro definition is required to ensure the debug expansion does not evaluate or modify token (e.g. by taking its address and writing). pthread_detach - signature/behavior is required to confirm it does not accept or modify the token (sanity check of called APIs for side effects). strerror - included to confirm it does not interact with or modify token. These symbols together allow checking all macro expansions and callees that reference 'token' or '*token' to determine if the pointer parameter 'token' or the object it points to is being modified, as relevant to the MISRA rule.
